content:
er 1, 2016
												**This review is based solely on my experience from MyCareer**TL;DR: The MyCareer experience is a solid 10/10.When you start your MyCareer for the very first time, you quickly realize, this "ain't no Spike Lee joint", but that's probably the best part of the story during your first season of your career. Without spoiling too much I can reveal that you're given two friends in the NBA (Justice and Denver) who will accompany you on your journey. These two are by far the best thing 2K have come up with as they are extremely well thoughtout characters, and the actor behind Justice, Michael B Jordan if I'm not mistaken, known from TV does an extremely good job at portraying your best friend. Put in contrast to 2k16, where Vic was supposed to be your best friend, the characters in 2k17 are actually likeable. Besides that, the story is well ridden and you get more "off court time" as you attend practices and endorsements/meetups, the latter being rabbitholes, but for "roleplaying" it's still nice. You get to actually play in college this year, although it is only for four or five games. Personally I would've loved to have played more in college, although I know other players hated the college experience. In the future I hope we get a chance to pick our starting conditions. i.e., do we want to play the college experience or 2k15's version where you are undrafted, and that way get a chance to pick who you play for (to some degree)Now to the actual gameplay. The gameplay this year feels much smoother than previous games. Your teammates are actually smart and will make plays and are more likely to shoot if they are open (no more 2k15 hugging of the ball when they are completely open). Defense play seems much smoother and thusly easier and the greatest change is the AI's better understanding of pick'n'roll plays, where you can with fewer button hits and thusly much faster tell them to screen for you and go to the basket for your easy assist. Final Judgement:If you're thinking about getting this game primarily for the MyCareer experience I can only strongly suggest that you do, as I rate this year's MyCareer a solid 10/10. You really feel part of the team, although the people who make you feel this way aren't on the actual team. The friendship you build are well written and the cutscenes make you want more. **A few bugs have happened for me though primarily the "no cutscenes bug" where you will go your first 10-13 games without getting cutscenes with Justice. **

content:
r 23, 2016
												Well, gameplay wise this iteration is definitely the smoothest yet. I don't have all that much play time, but i can tell you in the couple hours i've played exhibition games its extremely smooth and a good time. My issue with the game, and the reason why it's getting a negative review are as follows.1. Awful PC support2k just doesn't care about PC nearly as much as consoles, as PC is the black sheep and the consoles are where most of the cash cows are. They have their whales on PC im sure too, but console is where a  ton  of their whales are. Whales are people who buy obscene amounts of VC, which leads into my second and most important point. But first, there just isn't the support console receives on PC. Broken Vsync, a 60hz refresh rate, blatant port of certain menu features that are extremely weird to navigate on PC. 2. VC has become the central focus of 2k, and thats unacceptable.We've gotten to a point in the gaming industry where DLC is extremely prevalant, and generally accepted. This is a mistake in my opinion, but i won't go on a tirade about the industry. 2k pushes microtransactions on you CONSTANTLY. It was bad enough last year, but its only gotten worse. The amount of grinding necessary to get VC incentivizes microtransactions through the irrtation and slow nature of progression. This was clearly intentional. To get into the practice screen, you have to go through at least 4 loading screens, so by the time you get there your ready to rip your hair out because you've done this 20 times. This leads to people spending hundreds of dollars to upgrade their player, which is ridiculous in my opinion. A lot of people use the justification "well lots of games use grinding, it adds play time." There is NO way in hell it should take more than 40 hours of playing without microtransactions to max out your player. Everywhere you turn in 2k games there is ads for vc, begging you to buy more. Its not enough that we spend 60 dollars on a video game, no. You also need to have a continuous stream of income dumped into the game to be competitive unless you'd like to spend half the year grinding away in extremely boring modes. Having everything center around VC is a blatant and digusting cash grab that i hope stops, but i know it wont. Ultimately, if your looking for gameplay only, i suppose its an ok investment. Honestly spending 60 dollars just to play a few hours of pickup games makes me feel like an idiot, and unless you REALLY, REALLY love the other modes in NBA, id just steer clear of this. I regret spending what i did on the game. Im sure when the NBA season actually starts my play time will see a jump, and ill enjoy what i play, but god are they money hungry.

ber 23, 2016
												Finally took the plunge to get this on the last day of pre-release, after being sure that my old comp is able to handle the graphics. Here are my observations based on a couple of Myleague & PlayNow games:Likes:1. System requirement's pretty much similar to that of 2k16's. I'm running it on a bootcamp imac, i5 processor with GT750M.  so far so good, no crashes whatsoever. 2. player movement seems fluid, especially crossovers, hestitation moves etc. broke a couple of ankles using Jamal crawford ;D can't imagine what one can do with Kyrie Irving or Steph Curry3. Chris Paul sinks open jumpshots consistently now, unlike in 2k16 where I can't get him to score open shots to save his life/ team4.  Nice upgrade in terms of sound, love how it improves the atmosphere of matches5. Easier to draw a foul during drives to the basket. might be a bad thing unless you are using the Beard. i like it because this may deter cheap reach-in spammers Dislikes:1) Biggest beef with this game is the clunky OTF menu. 2K really took a step backwards with this one.  Now it's more graphical but less intuitive. how about not changing things for the sake of changing eh 2k? or at least give us a tutorial on the changes so that we don't have to spend so much time trying to figure it out ourselves? 2) The menu at time-outs gives me a headache. I've never needed to spend full 60 secs to get all my coaching instructions right in the previous 2Ks.   Player substitutions during time outs do not take effect until the next dead ball, this has to be a bug?!?! I've to get around this by using OTF substitutions with intentional fouls.3) Graphics issues - clippings, players with invisible arms4) Can't specify strategies before start of games?? 5) Can we customise our line-ups in the coach options BEFORE the games so that we don't have to change it every single game? Overall I'll still give it a thumbs up coz there isn't a better b-ball game out in the market. Hopefully they are able to resolve some of the issues by the first update...

content:
er 23, 2016
												NBA 2k17 is the newest basketball game in the long running series by Visual Concepts.There are several modes and something for mostly everyone who enjoys basketball. Such as MyCareer, an RPG mode where you play as a highly touted and scouted rookie who can barely dribble a basketball, who somehow winds up in the NBA. It's a real feel good story. In MyGM mode you can manage your own team, while other GMs try to screw you over every chance they get. Don't worry, you can take your frustrations out on your loyal fans, and gouge them for everything; ticket prices, parking, even refreshments! A true to life basketball business simulation.Or you can play online against other players in various modes, everyone will have mostly the same experience as the netcode hasn't been touched since the Dreamcast version of the series.Overall, NBA 2K17 is the best basketball game on Earth, mostly by default. Also gamers, don't forget to fuel up with Gatorade™ and MTNDew™, since the game will remind you every chance it gets.

content:
ber 26, 2016
												NBA 2K17 Review :(Based on my experience so far in the game)Pros or the things that i like :- First off this year 2K17 is huge improvement from last year, all what you hear are mostly right, the gameplay are much smoother, the way you handle the ball is really felt amazing,  doing dribble moves crossover here and there breaking ankles. - The layup meter is actually not bad even though you have to get used to it first. - Difficulty Hall of Fame this year finally doesn't feel like in 2K16 where your opponent is unreal, this time it's hard but it's fair, i really enjoyed playing in HoF, great challenge to test your skill. But if it's your first time try from Pro then work your way up. - MyCareer and MyLeague are also huge improvement (these are the main reason i am buying this game)- In MyCareer great story line. Where else did you get a sport game with great story? It's a huge plus, it felt like an RPSG (Role Playing Sport Game). the caps are really strict but personally i like it, but it could be improved. - In MyLeague you can start with additional teams and start from off season so you can fix whatever your favorite team doing wrong this off season(yes i am looking at you lakers)Cons or things i dislike and needed to be fixed immidiately :- Start with gameplay, broken defense. Okay sometimes my guy just leave his assignment even though i don't need help on defense. and that mooving screeen (it's not technically a screen, but it feels like you just being pushed by your opponent) it is totally needed to be fixed. even though sometimes you can use it to your advantage to get open shot, but still it's a broken defense- The cap, yes i like it but it's very strict and could be improved like after practice that cap upgrade not only it upgraded the overal cap of the upgrade we can buy, but also the max level of that upgrade path.Ex : like in the shooting 3pt path i can only upgrade until level 15, after practice and filling those doing work bar and level up, it could be used to increase the max level to level 16 3pt. Overall :Yes I love this game, but i hope patches are coming in the future to fix this. I know 2K worked hard on this to be a perfect basketball game. but until i get these problem fixed i give this game 8/10PS : I am not really interested in myTeam but it's pretty good, collecting cards, doing challenge playing game online, but you need serious vc if you want your team to be good fast, and i am not really a fan of that.

content:
ber 26, 2016
												7/10It would be a 10 out of 10 but the game has some pretty annoying cons that 2K would have to consider fixing!Overall a great game! But.....Pros:- Gameplay is solid. Very good work done here. Everything runs flawlessly in-game. Graphics are pretty good, movement of players and with or without ball seems real, shot animations and animations in general work smoothly and appear real on eye.- Game atmosphere it's fantastic! Fans graphocs and animations are awesome and even a friend of mine when I sent him a video of a buzzer beater I've managed, he didn't realized this was a game but thought this happened IRL.- MyCareer story is good, although replacing two players IRL with two new (Justice Young and Denver Levins) is somewhat not ideal.  It would prefferable for 2K to have given them another role in-game.- MyGM mode has not changed a lot, at least until the part I've managed to reach(still mid-season). Good thing they still let you choose the roster. Cause I did some edits I wanted.Cons:- MyCareer roster! 2K should let you choose an edited roster like on MyGM mode.- !!!!!!  MyCareer system of upgrading your player is pretty much annoying!!!! Forcing you to buy extra VC if you want to quickly update your player. Even participating in all practices all you gain is extra upgrade points and no free attributes gain. If you want to increase your attributes you'll have to pay. I may understand that putting player stats on the server side and forcing you to buy upgrades with VC is to catch cheaters on myPark mode but I think that MyCareer player and MyPark player has to be seperated! Or at least give you a chance to choose so when you start your Career.-1,5 for this  on overall score- MyGM mode had from previous year the "Relocation" option. Well this was a good feature that needed improvents and none made. To the point. The game let's you stay on the same city and not even rename the organization. That's pretty awesome!But the game does not let you finish tha application without alternating your court and jerseys. Why? All I want is just to upgrade my arena's features to have a more attendance and game revenue. I don't want to change either my team's jerseys or the court design.  For example I have Bucks! I like their current uniforms and court desings(they have two different). I don't want to change them. But game does not let you complete the relocation application.-1,5 for this too.So overall score is 7/10 for only two cons in the game. But these are so annoying that leave a bitter taste at the end.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
r 2, 2016
												After almost 50 hours with NBA 2K17 I can say it is a superior basketball game to it's predecessor - 2K16. You won't see the improvements on video footage since graphics are pretty much the same (except sweat and players body types) but as with the gameplay improvements - they are there.First of all, when you play your first game you realise how much more fluid the controls over players feel. Slower players are finally not totally useless as even they can contribute to the score not only by attempting 3 point shots but also SUCCEFULLY driving to the basket. Yes, attacking the basket off the dribble actually makes sense this year and yet it's not really easier. New thing with this game is that you have to time your every shot - including layups, floaters, post hooks and shots under the basket. It's difficult to get a hang of at first but later you can appreciate this addition as every "green release" goes in - yeah, NO MATTER WHAT. Shot meter this year is different too and it seems that timing the shot perfectly is a lot harder. As I mentioned before - controls are fluid, there is almost no imput lag (in offline games) and you can go from one crossover move to the other without your player bumping into the defender and being stuck in the animation afterwards. Crossing people and getting by them is a lot of fun and isolation plays make sense.What do I hate? Getting stuck on the moving screen and ending up 10 feet from the opposite team's player which happens constantly and some funky elements of MyCareer mode within its plot. It's far better than last year (10-minutes cutscenes are gone, HELL YEAH) with pretty interesting role of Michael B. Jordan playing Justice Young - an NBA prospect coming to the league undrafted which becomes your teammate and your best friend as well. The chemistry between your MyPlayer and Justice is pretty believable and not-so-in-your-face as with Vic in NBA 2K16. Playing a game with him on the floor is a lot of fun, too.There is a subject of face-scan for MyPlayer as well. I'm absolutely happy that it has finally arived on PC version but there aren't any more positives that come to my mind. It's a horrible process, horrible companion app for Android/iOS, just horrible overall. If you are not keen on that function coming into the game - don't even try it, because you will find yourself wasting HOURS on trying to get any decent scan that doesn't make your nose appear on your chin. You'll probably check it anyway so I won't bother spending any more time on it - it seems that creators were thinking the same. yuck.So overall, if you are a fan of both NBA and NBA 2k games there is no reason not to buy this year rendition of this franchise. There are a lot of neccesary improvements from previous game which makes me almost sure that I'll beat my time from NBA 2k16 at 508 hours in-game. Think no longer - get it!

ber 21, 2016
 This game should have been released in Steam Early Access for half price since it clearly doesn't play like a finished game. Too many CRASHES & BUGS to count! Crashes frequently on PC just like in 2K16 & 2K15! These games never crash in-game but just randomly in the menus of the various game modes. Every year I repeat the same stupid mistake of buying the new 2K basketball game thinking they will fix the crashing issues, THEY DON'T! I have a laptop and an extremely high-end PC I play on, as well as my brother who plays on a third computer. Every year all three of our computers randomly crash while  trying  to play this game. Therefore this is completely an issue of the game and not the computers! On top of all that this game runs like complete garbage on my PC running SLI 980 TI's. It runs even worse than last years game. The hair on players is transparent and there are many more bugs & glitches in-game. If 2K seriously cared about releasing a quality game, they would not only have fixed the problems that have plagued this franchise in years past, but would have correctly patched the previous games as well (as none of their patches fixed any of the crashing and still left many bugs). If I play MyLeague for an hour or two, I experience crashes to the desktop 2 or 3 times  minimum. It's as if these developers and testers didn't play the game at all before they released it.2K please offer me a job, my input alone is worth more than you pay these idiots to make this game. ATTN ALL PC GAME PUBLISHERS: When you resort to only releasing console games, don't blame the lack of PC sales on pirates when your abysmal games are not worth paying for!

content:
ber 16, 2016
												So this is a pre-release review with every intention of a follow up. For the most part it is a negative review.Cons:1) PC Disadvantage:-Pre-Release content. I heard that consoles were able to get the game a week in advance with just high school content. This enabled players to build the character up prior to the actual game. Unfortunately PC players didn’t get that option. Also Iv read that some people haven’t gotten any bonuses.-Graphics. Because the PC version is a port from the consoles, there is a big difference in performance. When playing on consoles, graphics are set; however when starting the graphics need to be tweaked. For those sporting a 1070+ graphics cards Iv read that they have been doing fine. I read a review where a person with a 970 sli was struggling. For majority of the people it is going to be like this: lower your graphics to get a faster gameplay, or increase your graphics to what you feel was acceptable by nba2k16 and experience a very laggy gameplay. I’m running a gtx970m, had no problems with the previous games on max settings but am struggling here. The voice acting in the cutscenes finish way ahead than the actual laggy video.2) Initial Story:-How can the personality of the character be so arrogant and pompous with the level designated to him. Jeez even number 1 draft picks in the game are given like a 78 or 79. Also why can’t we skip initial cutscenes?Pros:1) More options?-A lot more options are provided but I haven’t experienced them all. For instance, you can add 6 new teams into your mygm mode. Will add more with a follow up.Neutral1) Face Scan-Mix reviews about this. One would think that capturing a face scan on a cellphone would make things easier (because of the higher megapixels etc) but it is still challenging. Some people are able to get it with little effort while others struggle. Hence this feature is pretty neutral.Will be waiting for an update/patch for the game to answer the graphical issues. It sucks because pre-ordering it gives people the opportunity to play the game 4 days in advance. This graphical issue negates that advantage because playing on lowered settings spoils the experience for the user, while they have to wait for a patch. Right of the the Bat: console versions definitely better option. For the recommendation portion: If people pre-ordered this and got a discount on the price, then thats your advantage. However, if people paid full price with the option of playing earlier, then I don't recommend it. If you are like the majority where NBA 2k16 was running smoothly, there is a high chance it won't for the inital part of the game till after an update is released (which may come in a week or 2).

content:
r 21, 2016
												Due to having played NBA 2k for a decade, I have high expectations for these games.  The graphics are good, the offline play is good.   They made a change to allow you to sim to your teams draft spot instead of having to wait for every other team to pick their player in the draft.  That's where the good ends for me.  I tried playing myplayer but they have made these terrible cut scenes that you CANNOT skip until your completed one iteration of myplayer.  I tried and couldn't take it - it is too frustrating to be forced to watch cutscenes for a product that I've paid for, I shut it off after moving to my college team - I won't start it unless they patch in the ability to skip the cutscenes.The thing I live for in NBA 2k is playing against other people online, full court, NBA teams, I'm not interested in that mycourt stuff.  Playing online is terrible - the input lag is awful.  The players move around like they are skating on ice.  7 footers repeatedly miss uncontested 2 foot shots.  Instead of 7 footers simply laying the ball in or dunking they take fade away jumpers from 3 feet.  There are these repeated stupid canned animations for the ball rolling around the rim or bouncing up over the backboard to go out of bounds - it can happen upwards of 10-20 times in a 20 minute game.  They have made the defensive adjustments menu confusing.  Charges and over the back calls happen way too often.  I can't tell you how many times I will grab a defensive rebound and due to the input lag my player will then whip a full court shot.  Or try to make a fast break pass to an open teammate and the ball sails over my teammates head out of bounds - this happens 9/10 times on a fast break pass that is more than 20 feet.   The shot meter is awful.  There is in general difficulty even finding a match - they now have a timer showing the 'average wait time' for an opponent in online play but that is terrible information(and doesn't accurately reflect how long you will wait for a match) - give us a server browser, let us see players close to us, their ping, let us choose who we play against.  I'm upset there is no way to request a rematch after playing someone online.  There is no way to send a friend request after playing someone online.  There is no easy way to challenge someone ranked on the 2k leaderboards. You still can get to tip off only to discover you have both chosen the same jersey color, and if you've chosen the same team your game is going to be a pain in the rear.  As I said, I have high expectations but I don't think these are unreasonable things to expect from a basketball game in the year 2017.

												The reason for not recommeding this game is I am unable to play a game other than pick up games on MyCourt with friends. Trying to play a Head - to - Head, Team-Up, or MyTeam games is impossible due to non-connections to 2kServers. As soon as we enter the match, we are immediately kicked out with the prompt of, "You have encountered a problem connecting with the game. Your session will be ended." every time. But nope, no "luck" (As if luck needs to be part of their product). Regardless, if you're looking to play offline and single player, MyPlayer mode is about a 6.5/10 this year. RPG system they implemented seems tedious and inflated. Ratings will show a lot higher than the actual rating of your character. (i.e. a "90" rated player is somewhere in the high 70's or low 80's) Storyline is boring, and "immersion" into everyday scheduling is boring as hell. Would not waste $60 on this (imo single player game).Thanks, 2k. I have been a loyal customer since 2k7. Every year I'm disappointed, but you're my only option as a basketball fan. Guess I'll just have to drive my ♥♥♥ to my friend's house to go play your product. Being that it's 2016, you'd think we'd be able to play online consistently by now.

content:
er 10, 2016
												Best NBA simulation game ever. However, it is still a video game and has a ton of faults. Some that lead to extreme frustration. Some examples:-difficulty settings are not gradual. Playing on Pro is too easy and All-Star too difficult against AI. Your players miss open shots while the AI "NEVER" miss open shots (until rubber-banding kicks in towards the end of games). You can adjust the gameplay sliders for myGM mode, but not for myTeam.- players are lethargic recovering back to transition, and even after scoring a basket. I can't count how many times AI point guard made a half court pass to a wide open center under the basket for a dunk immediately after I scored. Even user controlled players are super slow to defent.- user controlled teammates are almost useless on defense. Jimmy Butler will lose his man ALL THE TIME playing on All-Star difficulty. C'mon man- offensive fouls are the dumbest in 2k17 since I can remember. They're called way too often, unless I'm trying to take a charge -- in that case the AI will just bump me and go right past the defender.- shot meter is different for all players and even different for the same player based on the shot, making it very difficult to time well. To make things worse, even if you match the meter almost perfectly but happen to go over, missed shot (even wide open) is almost guaranteed.- one of the most frustrating items in all of the 2k games is 6'1" point guards significally affecting layups of much taller offensive players. Countless missed layups. It includes dunks too. People with high dunk ratings will miss dunks when there's a defender nearby, no matter the size.- AI seem to be much better at FT% than their ratings (or real life stats) suggest- AI players shooting pull up 3s instead of easy layups on fast breaks (and always making them). EXTREMELY ANNOYING!!!- Dwight Howard hitting fadeaway jumpshots- Shooting guards will leave their assigments to cover Deandre Jordan at the 3 point line- goaltending called on dunks- one of my playoff runs had 0% attendance the whole time sans one game- crossovers consistently resulting in steals, no matter the dribbling skills of the ball handler- simulating games will consistently result in ridiculous results, to include 20% FG percentagesThis is not an all-inlcusive list of horse-dung in this game that will make you light your face on fire.All that said, an excellent game, a must have for any NBA fan.

content:
er 5, 2016
												In short, NBA2k17 is excellent from a gameplay standpoint. Pick a team and play with your friends and it's incredibly fun, as are most of the 2k games. Play on your own against the AI and it's incredibly fun. Play MyCareer and it's again just fun.But there are a few issues. I mostly play MyCareer and MyLeague. There aren't really any specific issues to MyLeague that aren't also in MyCareer, so I'll only talk about the latter.The biggest issue are the archetypes. I have no issue being limited in creating my player, after all it should still be realistic. That said what 2k did here isn't limiting, it's crippling. While the playing itself is fun, you won't create a superstar, like you did earlier in the series. You might be one, depending on how good you are at the game, but you could just choose a random role player and play just as good. If you only play myCareer it might not be apparent, but I have a higher rating than Patrick McCaw for example, but McCaw is clearly the better player, and it's not even close. I read that 2K is apparently tricking with their ratings in MyCareer, which to me seems to be the case.I understand that they want to make their competitive scene more interesting, but I think this is the wrong way.Another big problem is time. While it seems like they actually were able to cut loading times of games, the games feel a lot slower. What once was skippable pretty much immediately (timeouts and such) now takes forever. And while I appreciate the new style of the interviews, after the 10th time I just want to pick my answer and move on. Why do I have to watch myself walk out of the arena after every single game? Why do I have to watch myself walk at all outside of a game situation. I actually like the time managment and practice and all that, but just load. I don't want to wait ten seconds to walk out of my gym just so the game can THEN start to load.I probably forgot some things already. I can only stress that despite all of this the game is really fun. But if 2K were to improve some of these issues the game could be amazing. Right now it isn't, and that's so disappointing. At least it looks like 2K got back on track again after the abysmall 2k16.

r 22, 2016
												The reason for not recommeding this game is I am unable to play a game other than pick up games on MyCourt with friends. Trying to play a Head - to - Head, Team-Up, or MyTeam games is impossible due to non-connections to 2kServers. As soon as we enter the match, we are immediately kicked out with the prompt of, "You have encountered a problem connecting with the game. Your session will be ended." every time. Without fail, every damn time. Being that I've owned the game since release, and being that there has been 4 patches since release, I would have expected to play with friends by now. But nope, no "luck" (As if luck needs to be part of their product). Regardless, if you're looking to play offline and single player, MyPlayer mode is about a 6.5/10 this year. RPG system they implemented seems tedious and inflated. Ratings will show a lot higher than the actual rating of your character. (i.e. a "90" rated player is somewhere in the high 70's or low 80's) Storyline is boring, and "immersion" into everyday scheduling is boring as hell. Would not waste $60 on this (imo single player game).Thanks, 2k. I have been a loyal customer since 2k7. Every year I'm disappointed, but you're my only option as a basketball fan. Guess I'll just have to drive my ♥♥♥ to my friend's house to go play your product. Being that it's 2016, you'd think we'd be able to play online consistently by now.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
ber 17, 2016
 Reply to downvoted reviews.  Honestly I don't know what all the fuss is about, the game ran great on 2k16 and now it runs even better on 2k17. I am running the game on the highest settings and getting 60fps with a gtx 760 t,i i7 870 cpu, some cheap ten year old motherboard and 8gb of ram. The game has never crashed, froze, or lagged. The game is everything you want. It's extremely well optimized in my opinion and the gameplay and features are really excellent.  Gameplay and features  Honeslty I'm a big my league fan and they have added so much this year. Now you can expand your league up to 36 teams (you can make or own or choose one of the 2k created ones which are very well made). Also you can vote on league changes, when it comes to removing the shotclock, ovetime sudden death changes, and many many more. Now my career is incredible because you have many cutsenes and every person has a unique storyline for their player. You can text people to come to your house to 1v1 or practice. Texting has different responses for every text you recieve.  The shot meter is a full bar for a green release which in my opinion I love. The game is more realistic than ever. You actually feel you are in an NBA game. They are 500 new animated. What I like about it is that the cpu now actually act like real players, they won't pass to you to the ball 24/7 anymore. When you create your plyer you choose a position and then a playstyle, whether its shotcreator, sharpshooter, or many more. There are actually 7 to choose from. Different stats go up and down as you adjust your height, weight, and wingspan. End   Now clearly I didn't say all the things about the game as it is a quick review. Park is the same but I still love it. I don't play my team but I know they added a TON to it. Well I hope this review was helpful and made you buy the game.

content:
er 4, 2016
												A massive step backward from 2k16 which was already a shaky game. Do Not play against the A.I. though, stick to pvp as it is much more balanced. The game is designed to be challenging but it reaches a certain point (especially in MyCareer) when the game has to make you worse in order to keep up. Which is complete and utter ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. There were countless times where players I was defending literally glitched through me and made shots. I created a guy that had his shooting stats maxed out, I spent hours perfecting the timing on his shot. Yet, even if I played a game where all I took was wide-open shots, I would probably end up shooting 30-40% which is nonsense. The only time I felt my player shot a decent percentage we end up blowing out teams by 60 pts. so I turn the difficulty up hoping to balance it out. Wrong. My teammates who all have significantly lower shooting attributes shoot around 50-60% (with heavily contested shots) yet I can't make more than 2-3 shots in a row even if all of them were wide open. The hit detection is absolute garbage. I've had some of my shots blocked only to look at the replay and see the guy who blocked me not even touch the ball. I watch as the ball just kinda glitchs through my hand as though the game was like: "Oh, hey you're about to make an easy layup? LOL I don't think so idiot!" Trying to get good at this game while playing the A.I. is like trying to make free-throws in real life while an evil leprachaun makes fun of you and punches you in the ♥♥♥♥ everytime you're about to make one. It's beyond infuriating. Either the A.I. is really easy to handle or it just makes you look like you should've never played video games in the first place. There is no challenging in between where it's not infuriating but I still have to work for it. The worst part about the difficulty scaling is that once you reach a certain rating with your player you feel the need to bump up the difficulty a little, otherwise it gets too easy and the game isn't fun. So as your player gets better attribute ratings you bump the difficulty up a little so that you can still play well but also have to keep working for it. However, it reaches a point where it gets so difficult that you may as well just sit back and simulate the games (unless your some kind of nba 2k17 god) it reaches a point where the game is working so hard to beat you that it is nearly impossible to play well, regardless of your rating. I may end up with 26 pts. when it's all said and done, which is good, but I'll probably end up shooting 20% just to get there. Shot timing is very finnicky, especailly on harder difficulties. Sometimes the shot meter even starts before you've caught the ball and you're stuck with a late release. Wouldn't it make more sense for the shot meter to start when, oh I don't know, you start shooting the actual ball!!!! I can't remember the number of times I wanted to shoot immediately off a pass  by holding down shoot only to see the shot meter is already past the threshold for a make before I even release the ball. It's completely counter-intuitive and frustrating. The best option is to wait until you've caught the ball and wait for a moment so that the pass catch animation can finish before you shoot. The only problem is it takes waaaaaay too long, so by the time you can actually make a shot, you sort of can't because the A.I. moves nearly perfect on defense (especially beyond pro difficulty). So, by the time you've gotten open, caught the ball, and are now ready to shoot, you have a defender in your face who will make you miss the shot anyway. Yet you can also watch your teammates make the same shots with no problem at all, as the A.I. gets a near perfect release just about every shot. These seem like such minor problems that should have been fixed through beta testing, but, I would be surprised if they beta tested it at all. For now, I don't recommend this game until they figure out a way to fix all the shoddy mechanics. Stay away from MyCareer, as fun as it is in the beginning it quickly becomes infuriating. Play with teams in online pvp or manage a team in MyGM/Franchise and leave it at that. It's pretty much all the game is good for at the moment.

When you create your plyer you choose a position and then a playstyle, whether its shotcreator, sharpshooter, or many more. There are actually 7 to choose from. Different stats go up and down as you adjust your height, weight, and wingspan. End   Now clearly I didn't say all the things about the game as it is a quick review. Park is the same but I still love it. I don't play my team but I know they added a TON to it. Well I hope this review was helpful and made you buy the game.

												SO, this isn't really a review per se, but I do want to note that there is some performance issues (noticebly in MyCareer) that does need to be addressed hopefully in a later patch. I recommened that you play on all low settings with special effects turned off, and buffer count set to 1. I would even bring down the resolution to about 1440x900 [16:10], Anti aliasing set to 1, reflections turned off, and Max Anisotropy set to 1 for better performance. Playing on these settings is giving me a more smoother experience with the game. Again guys, hopefully this issue is only temporary, and they'll release a patch for PC here in the next few weeks for better performance. I'm using a NVIDIA GTX 970M grapahics card if you were wondering.

content:
r 22, 2016
												Every year they make changes to the game that make it worse in some way as they are mainly focused on increasing microtransactions.  They still can't figure out how to make the game half-way realistic, and instead simply adjust how much the computer can cheat physics.  The main reason I don't recommend this game is because you are at the whim of the computer almost the entire time you are playing.  Loose balls will bounce through 3 of your players but you won't be able to get to it because a portion of someone's foot is blocking you as you run in place.  A computer player will walk into your area and you get pushed back across the court like you're on an ice floor while your teammates watch. Myteam is a waste of time and simply there try and get you to spend money.  MyCareer is also pretty dumb.  It's cool to be able to build your own character into a star, but you have to sit through endless messages in a broken phone interphase, and cutscenes that add nothing but are forced to sit through.  MyLeague is not nearly as customizable as you would expect and ends up being pretty boring. If the basketball aspect of the game was better, the rest of the gimmicks wouldn't be as empty, but in the end the entire game seems cheap because of how sloppy playing an actual game feels.   It's not a very fun game and I definitely regret spending $60.

content:
ber 27, 2016
												NBA 2K17 is a game that doesn't stray too far from the formula.  This isn't a bad thing of course, why fix what isn't broken?  The most significant changes come in the career mode, which, while fun to play can seem a little heavy on the 'grindy' side.  There are some occassional issues with animations stealing control from you, or getting muscled around by heavier, stronger characters, and even moments when my controller inputs stopped working momentarily, but it never stopped me from enjoying the core gameplay loop.Not much is new here in terms of gameplay, but the window dressing around it seems a lot nicer and more streamlined.  This is another solid entry in the 2K series, and definitely worth your time if you're a fan of videogame basketball.  Not like you have many alternatives anyway.

content:
er 27, 2016
												I've been playing NBA2K Since 2k9. Xbox, Playstation, PC, you name it I've played it. I am a MASSIVE basketball fan.Somehow they manage to make the UI and controls even less intuitive every single year. It's really depressing considering neither Madden or UFC bring their games to PC. Just a terribly designed game.Every year they change the controls inexplicably, and the in-game controls and menus are unbearable.Want to replace a player in your MyTeam? You can't just switch them. Make sure you scroll all the way over to your starter, select replace from bench, seperate for collection, and then scroll all the way back.Want to make a substituion in-game? Good ♥♥♥♥ing luck with the horrendous UI on court. You'll have to open the menu and make the sub.Oh! But now you're ♥♥♥♥ing PF is inexplicably guarding their PG! So go to defensive subs and change those too. BUT WAIT.  You can't ♥♥♥♥ing access defensive settings until the substitution is complete! But regardless of this, you have to ♥♥♥♥ing press A to go through each ♥♥♥♥ing indvidual in your active roster to find the player you want to guard him. NOT EVEN THE PLAYERS ON THE FLOOR, THE ONES FROM THE BENCH. And then you get to watch endless minutes of digital dancers and coach speak pressing A frantically hoping to just play the game.Don't even get me started on the MyPlayer, even worse than last year. Want to be an average kid from an average family who gets good at basketball? Too bad! You don't even get your own nickname anymore. You get endless cutscenes of you as some douchbag with a dead father and a black kids voice who rose from the bottom to be named 'Prez'. I can't have the voice of an Asian, Mexican, or White kid? I can't be from the suburbs like Bill Lambeer? Oh, and the first coin pack you buy doesn't even get you enough to buy a single card back in MyTeam.I hope this franchise dies off. Pathetic.Edit: The Warrios blew a 3-1 lead and then lost on Xmas day :))))

content:
ber 21, 2016
												The game is beautiful and feels more fluid to me than 2k16.  2k has added more player animations as well.  The game has run flawlessly for me (I7 6600k, 980ti SLI) at over a 100fps with all settings set to the max as I ignored the guidance the game runs best at 60fps.  If you're a fan of basketball, especially the NBA, I highly recommend this game.  In my opinion, MyCareer is one of the best game modes for sports games today, hands down.  MyGM mode is great as well that I feel is chock full of features/options.  While others may be having issues with their controller, I haven't experienced this issue using an Xbox One controller and a Razer Wildcat.  I haven't played any online games at this point as I am entrenched in the MyPlayer mode.I will say, if you haven't played a 2k basketball game, the controls do have a learning curve, but once you get them down the game is absolutely amazing and virtually limitless on what you can do with a player.  2k has also added more options as it relates to the controls that add to the realism of the game.Overall, I highly recommend this game!

content:
ber 21, 2016
												The game is beautiful and feels more fluid to me than 2k16.  2k has added more player animations as well.  The game has run flawlessly for me (I7 6600k, 980ti SLI) at over a 100fps with all settings set to the max as I ignored the guidance the game runs best at 60fps.  If you're a fan of basketball, especially the NBA, I highly recommend this game.  In my opinion, MyCareer is one of the best game modes for sports games today, hands down.  MyGM mode is great as well that I feel is chock full of features/options.  While others may be having issues with their controller, I haven't experienced this issue using an Xbox One controller and a Razer Wildcat.  I haven't played any online games at this point as I am entrenched in the MyPlayer mode.I will say, if you haven't played a 2k basketball game, the controls do have a learning curve, but once you get them down the game is absolutely amazing and virtually limitless on what you can do with a player.  2k has also added more options as it relates to the controls that add to the realism of the game.Overall, I highly recommend this game!

content:
ber 27, 2016
												Pretty much rage deleted this pile of krap and for good reason. I am just sorry I wasted 60 dollars on it I really advise anyone looking at this game to at the very least WAIT till its cheaper. To start player control is atrocious. You can't cut to the basket, because you drift around. You can't pass on the dime because the AI for passing passes to the other team more than your own guys. It literally targets people across the court and into traffic when you want to toss it to the guy 5 feet from you. Sliders to fix this do nothing, I moved "openess" to damn near max to try and avoid the AI passing just throwing the ball to the other team....nothing fixes it,Of course the computer controlled teams suffer from none of this. And they cheat incessantly, and it gets annoying fast. But lets get down to why I rage deleted this game....this is the best part. I created my league, spent hours creating a pair of players, arranged rosters, meticulously setup their playtime rotations, I engaged in trades, scoured free agents to build the perfect team for the playoffs. Then...I played a FULL flippin season, like what a 100 games or something? I started simulating against easy teams and played contenders to keep myself the top team. So after all the hard work, I am trying to do the same in the playoffs. I play a few games get ahead of the team I am playing off against, and decide to go ahead and sim some of them. Fine I win the first matchup, so I decide to sim the second series and just play when and if it was close......well...with one button press I accidently simmed the entire thing.In like 2 seconds all that hardwork went down the drain, my team simmed to the finals and lost, despite my team being the strongest by far mind you. Never mind that I actually wanted to play the last series. But no it simmed to the end, and it autosaved the results, a quick ALT F4 did nothing. Literally DISGUSTED, you can't undo it...right because that would be "cheating"....so they effed my whole season up...with some clunky ridiculous interface with no way to undo it or redo it. This game is a pointless pile of steaming krap. You'd do well to stay as FAR away from it as you can.Honestly the last game I buy from them EVER!!!And to clarify I was not even selecting the last game, I selected the second series, yet some how in its inconsistent BS interface had an option to just skip the playoffs from any box on the playoff diagram....not on the last one mind you where it might logically be!! No 2nd tier playoffs top option on the menu is to sim the ENTIRE thing with no way to stop it.EFF you NBA2K17!!

content:
ber 29, 2016
												The MyCareer story is a huge upgrade over last year's story. Several cool features have been added (including additions to MyGM/MyLeague). Gameplay-wise this game really feels a lot smoother than ever before, though the CPU in the game got a lot tougher (which is good!).The only problems I truly have with this game, is the fact that the archetypes limit you to been more of a role player instead of a true superstar. I get the point that I might be more balanced in online modes, but since I don't really MyPark or Pro-Am, I kind of miss the fact that I can't be my own GOAT.Some minor things that bother me are that you start at 55 overal as an All-american High school player. The story tells you that you are by far the best player on your College team, but usually (if you don't buy VC) you have no stat upgrades yet. It's kind of saddening to see 2K follow the EA's / Activision's of this world in money grabbing.I still recommend the game, but 2K could've definitely been a bit more lenient towards the start of MyCareer.

content:
ry 16
												I did not want to rush to write this review. I also did not want to continue playing due to the addiction I felt developing. Yes, in just over an hour, addiction began. The first basketball game I really liked was "Double Dribble" after that it was the first "NBA LIVE" and after that I gave up on basketball games. None of them gave me the immersive feeling that the racing or flying titles of the same era were giving me. Today when I saw 2K17 was free for the weekend, I jumped at the chance because I know what 2K does. The career mode plays like a movie. That movie stars You. You as in You make a player that looks like You. They even have an app for your phone that will take a picture and send it to the game so the player will look closer to You look. I did not take a pic because I spent enough of my free weekend toying with the player looks. My son says the player looks like I at least tried to make me. I had to turn the career off because the cinematic "filming" and theattention to the details of the "movie" were making me forget that there are other game modes. As a Kings fan, I appreciate the accuracy of all of the jerseys and the logos in the Golden One Arena. The "on air" sports casters sat and spoke at the desk before the pre-game show. the pregame show came on. By this time I was fully entertained and ready to watch the game. Thats when I remembered it is a game and I cant just watch unless I set it to do so. Thanks to Mr. Cousins' skill and determination, we sent Mr. James and his backup dancers home with a loss. This game has me talking like a sports fan. The cameras transtition, pan, rotate and zoom all like a real bradcast. The gameplay is smooth. The playerr control is also smooth (used a cheap controller) enough for a non-basketball player to move around witout frustration. I give this 3 thumbs up. this is the best Basketball game I have played. I recommend this to anyone who wants to feel like they are playing a broadcast. I also recommendd this to anyone who enjoys any type of basketball as there are several game modes. I also recommend this to fans of sports cinema.

content:
ber 30, 2016
												This game absolutely sucks! I am so dissapointed that I wasted 60 bucks on a dressed up version of 2k16. MyGm has NO difference besides league expansion and a more stunning menu. They even took things out like being able to set your scoring options and other things along those lines. Forget not being able to play the pre-order at midnight, the game itself is a cop out. They put all their time into MyCareer and i'm sure the stupid card game too. Game play still is atrocious. Solid 3 point shooters are airballing way too often, the shot meter doesn't always stop when it should like it has lag, there are horrible fouls when the defense takes charges as you are merely running down court. Shooting is worse, user offense still turns the ball over WAY too often and AI never misses an open shot. Oh and about every game I have at least one player with his arms invuisible so you can see through his arm holes in his shirt and his hands just float. Annoying as heck. So, with MyGm being criminally neglected, gameplay as bad as I've seen it and an overall sense of playing the same game with more glitches I give it a 1 out of ten. Here's to hoping they majorly overhall this with DLCs.(I always play MyGm and start with high potential but, low tanking, young players. This is a video game issue in general but, when my players are lower ranked, they still shouldn't just make elementry school mistakes to compensate for the fact that a user is controlling them and making them perform better than their rankings suggest. I have NO PROBLEM losing, but I do have an issue with terrible gameplay when I am playing well.) Seems like they just don't put enough into USER Vs AI games since so many have moved to online User Vs User, which I have no interest in. Don't put something in a game if you are going to ignore it and put crap out there. So, really, if you can't make an all AI team play realistically against a User team than, you shouldn't release the game, period.

												Been playing MyCareer for a while. Haven't played 2K series since 2014 and I gotta say, it got even worse.1. Starting with 55 overall is ridiculous and doesn't even match up with the storyline. Isn't my character supposed to be the high school sensation with nickname Pres? And drafted in first 10 picks or so if you do a fine enough job? And then start out by having 55 overall and start with 8 min playtime. How does this make any sense. 2. On top of my so called the best high school player starting with 55 overall, Justice Young, who had to play in college for 4 years has an overall rating of 89. How does that make sense again?3. Orange Juice4. VC crap. I don't know when they started using VC system to improve your skills but it's just ridiculous.Edit: Great, the more I play MYCareer, the only thing that I can find more are the cons. In this game, your abilities are extremely limited. It means you can never create a character like Stephen Curry. You can either only have his 3 pointing shooting or dribbling. Also, if you wanna increase your already limited enough upgrade cap, you HAVE to play MyPark. This is ridiculous. Why are you forcing people to play MyPark? That thing is already filled with bunch of cheat code users and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. Maybe if they regulated and did something about them then MAYBE people would have played more on online. The contents of MyCareer can only get so far. It's already getting repetitive with all the stupid cut scenes that I'm not able to skip. At least in 2k12 I didn't have to deal with this and was able to enjoy my fully maxed out character. Now I can't even have that enjoyment because they want to limit people's abilities. If they're doing this to stop people from dominating so much on online, then it's already a HUGE FAILURE BECAUSE PEOPLE CONSTANTLY USES CHEAT CODE IN ONLINE.Thanks for the lesson though. I'm gonna make sure that I do further research before I buy any 2k NBA games again

Runs well, looks gorgeous, atmosphere in the stadiums is amazing, defense is improved, the gameplay is vastly improved, My Career is a good deal better this year and the fun factor is out of this world. If you are a basketball or sports fan, pick this up asap.How does it run? It runs very well! I am playing on a 660 ti and a decent i5 and I have everything at highest settings @ 1080p, getting steady 60 fps (only time it has gone below was duing my career, every other mode it stays at 60fps). Also have not had any crashes yet.For me the most important aspect for a sports game is GAMEPLAY. One reason I loved NFL 2k5, Blades of Steel, NBA Jam and NHL 94 so much back in the day, the gameplay! 2k has ripped the competition apart lately, Madden isn't what it use to be, NHL has had a few bad years,etc.. 2k could put out a crap game and get away with it but this here is the best 2k in years and so far a very ncie improvement over last years game.Not had any crashes or low fps so far to, imo the pc version is very good from what I have played so far. I have also tried the xbox one version and the PC version compares nicely. Oh yeah and lastly there is WAY less hackers online, I heard 2k was going at hackers hard this year, but never thought it would be to this degree, well done (last year I saw 5 hackers in the first few hours I was online, zero so far in this).I will comeback and add more to this review as I get more time with the game. But as someone who has played EVERY 2k game since it started, this just might be the best one yet. So far my only complaint is that the srevers could be a bit better on MY PARK, while slightly better than last years MY PARK (where you meet other players to use you're created player against), there is still room for improvements.Unlike a game like ProEvolution Soccer, this PC version is actually very well done and not an after throught to the console versions, you can tell 2k put a good amount of work on it. So far this is an excellent sports game and probably the best sports game since Rocket League imo.This is the best 2k basketball game since 2k8 and imo the best sports game overall since NHL '94ADDED IMPRESSIONS AFTER 102 HOURS =102 hours in now, I must say.. this game has A TON OF CONTENT. My Career is improved aswell, alot more to do in between games and the atmosphere/presentation is even better than years past, it really pulls you in. Enjoying it alot so far*

content:
ber 26, 2016
												As much time as I've put into this NBA 2K game, the hundreds of hours I've put into prior NBA 2K games, and also including the countless time I will put into this game from now on, I still can not, and will not recommend NBA 2K17 - or any NBA 2K game for that matter. I really do enjoy NBA 2K17: The MyCareer mode is great this year, the story is fleshed out enough to keep you interested, but not blown out proportionally that it becomes a laughing stock - especially compared to Spike Lee's awful attempt at an NBA story last year. (Not to mention Michael B. Jordan does a great job as Justice Young, the on court sidekick to your MyPlayer.) My only problem with MyCareer is that you can no longer simulate single matches without starting the match first and then pressing "Sim to End" from the pause menu. You always have to play a match to be able to do anything else in MyCareer.The mechanical side of the gameplay has really been improved, defense in particular; you can really put a good amount of effort in on D, and you will almost always have positive results, assuming you know what you're doing. Defense has always been a fault in NBA 2K games, you would often feel like you couldn't do much more than you did and still get beaten to the basket by the opponent. ISO moves have also been slightly improved, feeling less slippery, but also somewhat harder to use; you really have to practice the input timing, the distancing from the defensive player, and also have good enough court vision that you don't clumsily spin into another off ball player. I must say that sometimes it feels like the AI defense feels a little too good at spotting your movements; if you are expecting to drive the basket all the time, smashing the ball into the net, it is likely not going to happen, unless if  you are an NBA 2K master. The game really asks you to keep moving the ball around, because the AI defense will stick to you like white on rice. Moving onto what completely shuts down any positive outlook I have for this game. The single player experience is fantastic, in fact sit me down on a couch with a few friends for some offline multiplayer and we'd have a blast, but as soon as you bring the internet into the mix everything starts to go wrong. After years of NBA 2K releases you would think they would for once aim to make the online play work flawlessly, but that is once again not the case. it feels like all online modes are riddled with latency issues atleast 50% of the time, and sometimes the game likes to freeze up, telling you "WAITING FOR OPPONENT" but the game somehow still continues behind the frozen state. The My Park matchmaking is awful, actually there is no matchmaking - you would expect there to be some kind of balancing system in place to find a game, but instead you have to race other players for a place on one of the 9 courts, and hope a "squad" doesn't waddle in and steal up the match you've been queueing for, for the last 10 minutes.Pro-Am isn't the worst, but it does still have the latency issues, and not to mention that it often feels like in online matches your MyPlayer's stats are decreased considerably, as shots you take in Pro-Am, that would always be guaranteed baskets in offline play, often completely miss, no matter how open your MyPlayer is. The micro-transaction system has been hugely boosted this time around, 2K really want you to spend more money this year. And yes, I did - I know I'm only helping the terrible micro transaction system, but the grind it would take to get to a level where you can compete on a similar level to the other micro-transaction boosted players, and to even play at a level that is enjoyable would take such a long time that I caved in. I just wish you could carry your player over from the prior year, or just shorten the grind to level your stats. Either way after paying out for micro-transactions, you have to grind for a long time anyway to continue levelling your MyPlayer after a certain point, and that takes a long time in it's own right. So in conclusion/TL;DR: + Improved MyCareer, better overall story+ Improved Gameplay Mechanics+ Good offline play- latency issues online- Lag issues online- Unimproved matchmaking- MyPlayer feeling "Debuffed" online- Micro-Transaction pushed THROUGH THE ROOF I will continue to pray for the next NBA 2K game to be the one we deserve.

												So I can talk only about singleplayer/myCareer since I didn't play any multiplayer. As far into the game the story is good and it runs perfect for me. But if I compare 2k17 with 2k16 I would say that 2k16 would win here. I like it more than 2k17. 2k17 is harder to play and CPU is playing more defensive game. Movement is also a bit different in 2k17 and ball intercepting isn't correct in my opinion. I was standing in front of player and he still somehow got the ball through me. Getting currency is also harder and its kind of a farming type. You get less currency in 2k17 unless you will play extreamly good which isn't that easy at the beginning. You can buy it but that would ruin everything. I would say that player upgrades should be based on its work so you would play matches and attend practices and get a better player and not pay for it.I would still recommend 2k17 because it is a good game to play but if you already have 2k16 stick to it. 2k16 in my opinion is still a better game. Anyway on shot 2k16 is easier to play than 2k17 and for me it is a better game. Another bad thing is that you can't skip some cutscenes or some timeouts.

												Worst NBA 2K game ever! I am a fan of this game and recommended it to my friends all the time, not anymore. Despite of MyTeam being pay to win from the very start of the game because of the very expensive prepurchase bonuses, MyCareer mode is buggy and glichty as hell. There is a very bad voice synch problem with the cinematics and even in the game which makes loading screens, cinematic dialogs and commentary very frustrating. Even the game freezes because of that. In cinematics sound stops but animation of the characters goes on yet, their mouth freezes where the sentence cut off. If subtitles are off, sound continue from the timer of what the character has to say synching with the animation, yet if they are on, they continue from where they were. So cinematics end but the sound tries to continue. Loading screens are really frustrating too and I guess it is about the sound problem. It takes 20 minutes to load a game and I got a pretty good PC. It stops nearly at 39% and waits there for like 10 minutes then I hear Shaq speaking even the pregame show was over and I am looking at the black screen. And it stops at nearly 60-70% then I have to wait for 10 minutes more. While these waiting process music is gone too. And the commentary... Sound stops when they are trying to describe a situation and an attack later they describe the former position. Man this is pure s***! If there won't be any updates soon this s*** will be my last NBA 2K game!

												When this game came out I was excited to buy it but now here are some crucial bugs and failures that everyone should be aware of before buying it:CONS:- it's more like NHL and not NBA; players are sliding around and not actually moving around- AI can push you back at anytime and you can't do that to it- you can stuck between two AI's at any time meaning you are out of your position- AI is just stupid and mindless- physics are just horrible at this state; you are right next to the ball and you won't pick it sometimes- AI dribbles you whenever it wants you to; usually it slides around you- your earning are ridicolous; it's all set up to make you to buy virtual points- don't be surprised if there will be some AIs without their hand moving artound- you can't skip scenes- lots of bugs - average graphics (compared to NBA 2K16)PROS:+ still a solid game which has to be worked on+ career mode is much better+ you feel connected with the game+ it's still a fresh game which hopefully will be worked onDo I recommend this game? Not at this stage...maybe later when they fix some game breaking bugs and this will work much better. NBA 2k16 is a better choice ATM.

												I hate to do this but i can not thumb up this game for several reasons. Now do not get me wrong I love the gameplay of this game. I am a big fan of the MYteam and that part of the game is what I am writing this review off of. When i first started playing i had a game breaking glitch where every game no matter what mode I was in began in the 4th quarter with 2 minutes to go and down 8 points. It took me 30 minutes to find a reputable solution that involved me deleting game files to fix it. So after almost refunding the game i finally get to play and I notice domination is now 5 minute quarters instead of 6 like last year and the teams are more difficult as well. This wasnt all bad as it made me try a bit harder to get through the regular domination but was far more frustrating than I had expected.So i got a bit further got some decent players and went into MYteam online mode where you play in leagues. I got out of bronze quickly but once I hit silver league I have not been able to complete a game without a hacker/exploiter ruining the game. My last 2 games have ended in the 4th quarter with me up by 10 or more points only to have a message pop up saying unexpected error has occured and this game will not be counted. I no longer will play this game which is sad since I paid full price for it only to be let down by glitches and hackers that 2K could care less about and especially for PC gamers.

Here's a list of the pros and cons in the gamePros:BalancedRefined gameplayDecent StoryGood sidekickBetter league transitionsCons:some audio bugsMechanics are new in the game so they're bound to have bugs and a learning curveOverall, it's a fun game.

er 7, 2016
												Just because there is no alternative, we can't have a basketball game that allows us to play a decent basketball game. First EA ruined it, now 2K. Graphics alone doesn't mean anything, gameplay is the most important aspect of the GAME for gods sake, and the gameplay in this one... You can't play without saying "bulls*!?*it" per minute. I played basketball in my youth, I know how to play, I know what you can physically do and what you cannot. It has no relevance with this game. This is an arcade game that wants your money every turn. Sonic was a better basketball game.All jokes aside, the game doesn't move forward. This is very frustrating. The poor handles, unrealistic AI, sloppy and stupid moves, fixed animations etc. the list goes on. Each year we deal with the same problems. Oh yea right, we also deal with a new kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t each other year. My mistake. This year it is "Orange Juice". Don't let me start on this one. It's just plain horsecrap.Real players with experiences give down grades. Unfortunately there are some positive reviews, and by positive I mean kissass positive, which sound exactly like IGN kind, thus can mislead you.And all these, just for the offline part of the game... For the online part, just watch a season of Game of Thrones.PS: I forgot, I'M NOT ♥♥♥♥ING MURICAN, AND NOT INTEND TO BE ONE! So why forcing me to be an American and try to make me feel proud about something I couldn't care less? What were you thinking 2K? Seriously? Didn't you learn anything about last years Spike Lee disaster?

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
ber 23, 2016
												This is one HECK of a game!My hand/eye coordination is pretty lousy and I had reservations about trying a controller-based action game like this, but I am a basketball junkie and the vids I'd watched online looked absolutely fantastic.In addition to my lousy hand/eye coordination, I was a horrible basketball player when I was a kid and never played on a team or tried to coach later on....  Those factors and the fact I hadn't tried any sort of sophistacated graphics-based basketball game in any series for a long time meant I was *waaaaaaayyyyyyyy* behind the 8-ball on learning this game and getting any good at it.Long story short, I still suck, but not so badly that I didn't outgrow the "rookie" level in just a couple games.  Took awhile to get "too good" at the next level (its name escapes me), but I am now playing at "Pro".  There are three higher levels that I'll never get good enough to play.   Ever.Because of those six play levels, I can't imagine anyone getting so good at the game that they can regularly beat the computer at the Hall-Of-Fame level.  Of course, just cuz I can't imagine it doesn't mean it's impossible...  But it'd be reallllly hard to do. Anyway...  This game is flat-out *AWESOME*!  I've finally figured out how to successfully do stuff like dunk and get a good running game going with my now-I-can-dunk Warriors.  Nipped the Spurs in a tough battle just now...The flow of the game is terrific, graphics sharp and smooth, at least with my snappy new gaming-level PC.  Yes, this game needs quite a bit of computing power to run well with graphics settings on High.  I would think most reasonably up-to-date "everyday"-rated PC's would do okay on this game with video settings knocked down a bit, but to really enjoy this game at its best you'd probably need something pretty close to my rig (Intel i3 chip running at 3.9 Ghz, 16 gig RAM, Nvidea 970 GTX video card with 4gig rom).Thus far, I haen't done things like MyPlayer or MyLeague, and so far I have almost no interest in even trying them.  I've just played random games with me always controlling the Warriors.   LOTS of games!  Haven't tried any games against online opponents either, and don't really wanna try it.  So, on those sorts of features, I can't say anything.To those who are complaining about things like missing legs or arms on players or other strange graphics glitches...  UPDATE YOUR VIDEO CARD'S DRIVERS!!The few things I've gotten a little tired of would include things like the pregame and halftime shows (fun at first, but quite repetitive after not very long at all) and the really repetitive timeout huddles...  Oh, and the rather creepy-looking player and coach interviews where the lipsynch is rather off...  Fortunately, you can skip through these for the most part.Overall, this game just plain kicks butt!

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
ber 23, 2016
												So far the best NBA 2K in years! I am still in the first season of myCAREER, starting out low as usual, still getting drafted among the top 20. So while every other NBA team picks up a 70+ player (some are higher), the Denver Nuggets decided to pick this white guy with an average rating of 55. And with hard work and no (real) money spent, thanks to "Doin' the work" and generous VC gifts from ingame sponsors and becoming a better player, I am, after 22 hours played, already a 74 average player. And the growth continues. "Doin' the work" is actually an uncomplicated system, also gives you minor improvements for free and allows you to raise the ten skill categories which you spend your VC on (besides Badges, clothes and stuff for your private court).The story is actually not terrible. You team up with Justice Young (played by Michael B. Jordan) and form the dynamic duo "Orange Juice", which actually sounds completly batshit insane in the beginning but it's not as horrible as being called "Frequency Vibrations" in 2K16. It also unlocks a major feature of the game, the duo-controls which enables some great plays. You even get a voice that seems to match most ethnic groups you can choose from and the story is not horrible at all. Your mom only calls on the phone, your father is dead and so there is no major drama except for the stuff that happens in the team or if you decide to skip on (team) training. No Spike Lee is also a major improvement.Technically the game runs flawless for me except for some black players sometimes losing their arms in the middle of the game. If somebody could explain to me now why my player always has to walk so many ways to leave places I would be really happy. Did nobody test the game before and figured out it's beyond annoying?

content:
16
												Great game, the gameplay is solid and it looks beautiful. MYTEAM is very fun with lots of challenges and different things to do for rewards and such. MYCAREER is okay, it does get repetitive pretty fast and the storyline is a little too foolish for my liking, especially for a basketball game. I find the texting feature that your player has very annoying, also with some of the cutscenes being way too cheesy. It just don't suit a basketball game. Pro-Am is extremely really fun to play since you and your friends can make a team and play against other people online. This mode definitely doesn't get old. You can even customize your uniforms and arena which is pretty sweet. MYPARK is okay, it definitely isn't realistic at all, such as the crazy dunks, people dunk over you like you aren't even there and it's impossible to stop them. The alley-oops in park are also terribly unrealistic to the point where you can alley-oop people everytime even though the defender is all over them. But overall, the game is well done. If you like basketball, you should really check this game out!

content:
ber 21, 2016
												For all those complaining about performance issues, worry not. Im running on a laptop, Nvidia Geforce 950m, i7-5700hq, blah blah blah. compared to a desktop obviously its nothing but for a laptop its pretty good. with that said, i expected decent graphics at least. when i started it up, the game was unplayable. Solution: make sure your graphcis card is on. desktops use dedictaed graphics all the time, laptops don't (to conserve battery). nvidia didn't update the drivers yet for this game, so i had to go into the nvidia control panel and enable this game manually. still not 100%, as it would be better if the drivers updated, but wow what a difference.Quick Tip: Update drivers. Check Geforce Experience, then check the website, as sometimes the Experience app thing can be a bit wonky, especially since the app itself updated.Hope this helps some of you out there.

content:
ber 21, 2016
												I don't see why all these people are having issues with this game...Lets first address all the "OMG LAG" comments. I have a GTX1080, 16GB of ram, and a stock i7 4790k. My machine is no slouch by any means, but I also stream at 1080P in 60FPS and this game still runs fine for me, those complaining about the FPS most likely haven't troubleshooted and/or updated their drivers yet.This is my first 2K game as well as my first sports game Ive owned on PC, yes it is strongly recommended to use a controller but that was no issue for me since I had a spare XBOX one controller laying around.MyCareer is one of the funnest experiences I've had in awhile, you create your own character (the face scan leads to some funny moments) and you can play on a basketball team and lead them to the championships. It does take awhile to get enough VC to upgrade your character, and the reach in foul calls get a little ridiculous sometimes, but those are the only complains I have.Now onto the complaints of the main game, Why in sweet ♥♥♥♥ can you not skip cutscenes? It also gets annoying watching your player (mycareer) leave your place every 5 seconds. Other than that I'd say this game is definitely worth the 60$

content:
er 13, 2016
												Offline this game is pretty decent. Mygm is great, and my career is decent. If your into playing these modes I would give it a 4/5. However if your in for myteam, mypark or pro am I got news for you it ♥♥♥♥ing sucks. There are hardly any players ever in the courts. 2K also refuses to put a cheat engine in the game and they pretty much neglect the pc community almost entirely. content:
er 16, 2016
												Ok, so I have played this series for many generations now, since 2k13 and sadly every game has the same problem when playing against the AI. You're not playing the same game as the AI. It's borderline impossible to stop a drive from the AI if they drive you'll have to run alongside them and try to block their shot. If you try to drive against the AI It will almost never ever work because the AI's players have small invisible zones of no ballmovement around them and it's impossible to run past them. No like really, it's impossible.No I'm not making this up, it means that unless you have a clear path, like literally no one at all defending, you WILL get stoped and at best your player will grab the ball and you'll have to pass it. At worst your player will fumble the ball and you've made a turnover.This years version makes this even more frustratingly obvious because something that is "new" in career mode is that you'll have to grind drills in the gym against the AI. Sometimes it's just shooting hoops from one spot and that's uninteresting and tedious but manageble but then comes the 1v1 drills... they've designed a system where the AI is unbeatable 1v1 because you can't drive past them and they can just walk past you and you can't do anything to counterplay and they've implemented a system where you have to GRIND these drills. Makes my career almost unplayable.Now why, do you ask is it like this. Well because if it's not it's not very hard to faceroll the AI. Is it a good solution, no way in ****. The game is extremely frustrating to play and you will always have the feeling that it's stacked against you, because it is.There are some improvements, they've finally fixed the bug for some people where you could only play in offline mode or risk the game crashing the my career mode is less crap than it was last year but still worse than 2k15. The game is somewhat managable if you play a strong center and just avoid driving to the hoop alltogether. But all in all this is the same game as they released last year (and before that) with a new UI some minimal game changes and the only reason to buy it is because there is no competitor. FIFA 17 makes this look like a really bad joke in all aspects other than the, football is boring aspect.
