content:
ber 29, 2016
												Contrary to some haters, this is a really fun basketball game.   The GM mode is a BLAST and the expansion team creation is super fun.  MyCareer is awesome and yeah you have to use VC to increase your character, but you earn VC for EVERYTHING in the game and you can earn it on the companion app.   I haven't played 2k since 12 so there is more new features than those moving up from 16, but if you buy every year, you are probably either a sucker or a super fan.  Now for the downside.  It's a sports basketball game, so increasing the level just feels like the computer cheats and rigs the outcome more.  Also Klay Thompson 3 pointer is jacked.   Other cons are charging is messed up players stick to other players too much in the paint causing 3 second violations way too frequently.   Don't be turned away from the haters.   Buy this game if you want a great basketball game that will be fun online and offline, don't buy this if you expect to be the best online player without spending gobs of real money.

content:
ber 27, 2016
Product received for free
												Love the NBA? Want to play an NBA game on the PC? Yes you say? Well, let me tell you a few things about this wonderful game! Have you ever wanted to decide between facing an invisible opponate online or giving your computer a sexually transmitted disease? We have you covered! Either disable your antivirus while playing online or you will have to defend against invisible players in mypark! Have you ever wanted  to get a middle finger from an A+ game devoloper? Yes? Well, I have great news for you! You get two middle fingers for the price of one! You get one middle finger for playing on the PC. You will be the last to receive patches, roster updates, or anything else game related. That is if you get a patch at all. Does not matter how broken the game is! You get that second special middle finger because 2K released a buggy mess this year to all the special boys and girls. PC and console alike. Have you played a game and thought, "You know what this game needs? More random crashes."? NBA 2k17 Legendary Mess Edition has you covered. You can expect that when you upgrade your char, a badge you have already earned will keep popping up and crashing your game. Who would have thought that 2K would combine the great feeling of watching your character progress with the feeling you get as your game winks out on you? Pure genius!Are you worried that they will fix the buggy mess that makes the game unplayable? Don't be! Do not forget that you are a red headed step child in 2K Sport's eyes. Your step brother Jimmy will get that shiny new BMX for Christmas, but not you. No, you will get the greatest gift of all. Socks. There is a 7gb patch for the PS4. They said it is coming soon to XBOX One. They made no mention of PC though . So, the good times keeps on rolling with random crashes and players missing arms and legs. With all these unsupported bad ports, it has never been a better time to be a PC gamer! Do you love game companies miliking you for money after you purchase their game at A+ game prices? Yes? Well some more good news. 2K really stepped it up this year. Every time you upgrade your char, the default position of your icon rests on the "Purchase VC" button. So, you will hit that a million times over the span of upgrading your character. Each time you hit it, you will be lovingly reminded how much 2K really cares about your wallet. I know you are probably thinking, "Maybe I will wait to buy this Procious.". I get where you are coming from, but I have one sentence that will change your mind. Spike Lee did not write or direct for 2k17. Boom! You are now sold, right? I was too! All jokes aside: The game's storyline is better this year and it has better potiential than 2k16, but it is a buggy mess and it does not look like that is going to change anytime soon. If was not a Basketball game nut, I would not have logged the hours I have. I would wait for a good patch or not buy it at all.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 15
												TL;DR: (6.75/10)The graphics and presentation are top notch but numerous gameplay problems hold it backGraphics: Awesome (9/10)2k has been getting this part right for a while. The players and courts look realistic and move in realistic ways (at least most of the time) The only problem I could point out is that some textures are inexplicably blurry despite being in a high resolution. This is easily countered by using something like ReShade to boost the sharpness, but it's worth pointing out.Presentation: Awesome (9/10)Any 2k fan worth their salt will tell you that this series has perhaps the best presentation of any sports game series. The commentary is organic and lifelike and the presentation is top notch. The attention to detail really shows! However, like graphics, there is one small problem worth pointing out: There's so much presentation that you have to mash the "A" button after just about every basket and especially before the game/after the game/between quarters to skip all of the flashy presentation just to get back to the gameplay with no way to turn it off.Game modes: Awesome (9/10)Ok, I admit, I've given the game a lot of credit with three straight 9 of 10's. The thing is that these three things are the things that 2k does better than ANYONE ELSE IN SPORTS GAMING. In fact, they've been the best since at least 2k11. There are so many game modes and each one of them is very well fleshed out. Only a handful of changes would make them better, and they're pretty much irrelevant. Customization: Good (7/10)2k is better than most when it comes to customization, but there is so much room for improvement here that if you're looking for a fully customizable experience, you won't feel disappointed, but there are other games that do just as good or better. One thing to note is the team relocation mechanic that allows you to fully customize the NBA and even add up to 6 teams to the assosiation in a variety of game modes. The problem for people who love to customize (Like myself) is that this option is ONLY available in certain modes and is not normally available through the main customization tools like player creation and roster editing. This is a major disappointment, and really needs to be remedied in 2k18 (or even patched into this game)!Gameplay: Passable (5/10)Here it is, the one thing 2k17 struggles with heavily! Unfortunately, this is the single most important part of the game for 99% of people! Here's a list of just some of the most glaring issues. (Many of these carry over from 2k15/2k16)-The game is slower than real life, players jog around the court and take floaty shots (set gamespeed to around 55-60 to fix this easily)-Animations are sluggish, this is especially the case with dribble moves as they are useless most of the time-It's entirely too easy to get drawn into animations, just run into the back of a player on a fast break to force them to slow down and let you get beside them or even pass them up while rarely drawing a foul in the process-The AI is all-knowing, making plays with its back turned on a regular basis and simply stands around rather than rotating on defense or getting open on offense-Layups are too easy to make meaning running toward the rim and spamming them is usually a winning strategy even on higher difficulties-Fouls are too easy to rack up as they get called too often-And-ones go in on a regular basis rather than making fouls mean something-Speed is non-existant in this game as players like Shaq can keep up with Allen Iverson in most situations-"FAST BREAK, WHAT FAST BREAK? PLAYERS DON'T HAVE UNCONTESTED FASTBREAKS!" says the game. In 200+ hours I've had 1, YES 1, uncontested fastbreak despite telling players to run in transition-Invisible walls on the edge of the court put on extra "Player Repellant" this year, meaning that you can sometimes run head first out of bounds and get knocked back in by nothing to keep you in play-The mid range shot is useless in this game, open or not. Unless you're Michael Jordan.-Dunking in traffic is nearly impossible, leading to easy blocks on most of them even if you go up with two hands. Unless you're Michael Jordan.-Most of all, the game often considers "well contested" shots that would normally be open rendering stepback J's and shooting from screens pointless.If there are so many gameplay problems, then why recommend the game? Because most of the issues can be fixed by creating your own sliders for the game. After tweaking the settings, I would say that it gets closer to a 7.5/10 or so. If you don't want to make your own, then you can always download someone else's sliders, even mine if you want. The thing is that even my sliders aren't perfect and are constantly being updated for realism/balance/fun.

content:
ber 24, 2016
												I "played" this game for 89 minutes.  I'll break down my actual gameplay time:-10 minutes total of character creation, menu navigating, setting options like camera/etc.-7 minutes of actually playing basketball.-62 minutes of watching a cutscene, the game crashing, rewatching the cutscene, the game crashing.  Finally it works, oh wait no it doesn't because it crashed again during the game instead of right after the cutscene.The cutscenes cannot be skipped and the game doesn't remember if you already watched them or not.  I watched the stupid Kobe MyCareer cutscene maybe 5 times, and that's a long one.I well exceed the minimum requirements for this game, as well as any other coming out in this day and age.  I'm not at the max specs either, but closer to max than min definitely.  A computer like mine not being able to run your game means that you are not optimizing your game well.I've played the NBA 2k series since back when Allen Iverson was on the cover and even when it was out on Dreamcast.  Literally my whole life has involved this game in some way or another.  It pains me to refund this game, the first time I ever refunded any game on Steam, but I just can't reasonably spend 60 dollars and then just hope that they patch the PC version.  And honestly, there's been so many problems with the 2k series since 2k15 that I'm just gonna stop buying these games until these issues are helped.Is this game good for a casual basketball fan?  Probably.  It has nice graphics and smooth gameplay like all the others.  But to anyone who actually knows the game well and expects certain kinds of behaviors by the AI, you'll be infuriated.  I already saw videos about how the help defense problem is still there, the shots the AI makes on high difficulties, etc.  The VC gouging once again back strong.  I just can't do it anymore.

content:
y 10
												So after finishing my 1st season as an NBA Pro winning Rookie of the Year as well as taking home the Title for my team Utah Jazz, I decided to take my talents elsewhere. I had suspected early on with the new "Orange Juice" thing that you're pretty much going to be stuck with Justice Young for the rest of your career. Well I was correct, I get signed to a new team in hopes of going solo but no Justice just came along with me, which I don't understand how teams could afford both of our salaries but whatever. I get that Michael Jordan is a big perk for the game but it's almost too easy considering you have another teamate that will for sure put up numbers for your team so the whole time it's like having a handicap in which I don't like about MyCareer.    Also If you're a fan of the series or have been and played through 13-16, you will notice that Jackson Ellis appears in these games as well, I've made it my personal mission to not accept any requests to hangout with him due to he's a d-Bag in the other games, long time rival, blah blah blah. Screw Ellis he sucks ain't even on the same level. Game mechanics are dope, some of the dunks are gone but nothing that damages the game... There are many of the game modes that I haven't gotten a chance to play around with yet but overall the game is just what you would expect from 2K nice solid gameplay, a few hiccups here and there but If you're decent at the game you will fly through games with a pretty nice stats.   I don't usually rate games but this one I will have to give a 8.5 out of 10 mainly because of the Justice Young thing in MyCareer, somehow 2K finds a way to screw with the MyCareer when all we really want is to work our way up from the bottom, dominate, collect badges, get buckets, make VC, without a whole story pre-made... If they gave the option like a multi-layer choice based system, I don't see why this game couldn't take on other franchises such as FIFA which does a phenomenal job at everything they do with that game. That being said, pick it up cheap or wait until next year or keep playing the previous year because you're not missing too much.

content:
ber 27, 2016
												This game is unbelievably bugged. I've played only for a few hours but have already experienced several bugs1. I've caught the time running while waiting to inbound a pass2. CPU started intentionally fouling me when there is like 50seconds left and im only up by 1. And when I did get fouled through the bonus it only gave me one shot instead of two. LOL?3. Even after tampering with Vertical sync all of my cut scenes are still being played at 3x regular video speed, and 1x audio speed and always end abruptly without seeing all of the content.4. Just did one of my first shoot arounds on myplayer, I was almost completely done filling that top practice bar then all the sudden the practice teammate started derping around trying to pickup the ball. It went on for 20 minutes and wouldn't allow any button on controller or keyboard to exit/save or anything. I had to alt-f4 and lose the experience. the Cpu ran around the court non stop trying to pick up the same basketball.5. Want to play with a 360 controller and a ps4 controller with a friend? Goodluck. Causes massive issues and constantly randomly disconnects your controller. You seem to have to use the exact same controller for every player.More things I don't like:1) MyTeam is confusing, It may have been like this in other games but why.. I make a team, My court is defaulted to the Hawks, yet Im from New York, Scoreboard says Timberwolves and i'm wearing the wizards jerseys. Like wtf. Who approves this stuff? 2K, your desire for dlc/paid content has gone too far and its just straight up confusing for new players.2) Curry is just ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ly op. I know hes insane in real life. I love to watch it. But I played against a friend who I normally beat with the Knicks. He dropped 42 points with curry himself in one game. 80% of those shots were deep, chuck shots over coverage. Like 40 footers under heavy coverage..  42 points, (and this is half game length of real life. So essentially on track for 84 points in real life. And he is a noob like me taking low percentage shots. I understand he should be really good. But thats just ridiculous. The sliders were on default - Pro difficulty3) The substitution/timeout design is horrid. 2k16 was wayy better and user friendly. Its very awkward trying to read all these player names sideways and upside down. It is also very awkward to access the other menus like setups/defensive tendencies.4) PC online gameplay forces you at 60fps. I want to use my 144hz monitor!5) No chat box/quick comms like Rocket League, On the MyPark blacktop there no way to communicate with other players

												Mechanics are great, animations are great, VC Grinding is bad but what the heck.This game had it all on point and with Spike Lee gone, it kills me to not play it. Cheaters in MyPark are slowly getting banned and that should calm most buyers down as I have not seen any non-legit 90+ overall so far as I'm concerned. Its pretty easy to get to 90 on MyCareer in a week or two. This game has whole lots of fixes. It runs great on my GTX 980 at 60hz with VSync ON. My only problem is that at 120 hz, all the cutscenes get messed up and fast forwards all the time and is as expected as this was noted by 2k while changing your refresh rate settings. Overall, this game is worth the buy if you have the time to play it but not a great buy when time is a big factor for you in playing this game's modes other than casual "Play Now!" gaming.

er 13, 2016
												This game is utter garbage. Too many cheaters online. When I play against the computer on All-Star it cheats. Whenever I make a 3-pointer (which hardly happens but the CPU on the other hand always makes them) the CPU always returns the favor no matter how much I defend. For instance, Lebron ran through 4 of my defenders and dunked. NOPE! NOT POSSIBLE. My team runs around and doesn't stay on the person they're supposed to be defending. Instead i notice them move out of the way and let the other team go right in for a free-bee. CPU runs right through you like a ghost. I can't control every person!  My team can't rebound worth ♥♥♥♥ like the CPU can. They can't even make wide open 3's (I play warriors and I shoot 3's with Curry, Durant, Green, and Clark). Okay I can't make my 3's, then drive in. NOPE! Try to juke them, STOLEN! Try to run in, CHARGING! FOUL AFTER FOUL. They get all these free throws. I try to block, FOUL! Okay noted, just stand their instead. NOPE! My player will automatically block for me if I don't click it. FOUL! Like I said at the beginning... UTTER GARBAGE. The real players cheat and so does the CPU. Don't buy this ♥♥♥♥ed up game. It is nowhere near real basketball. All the games are already planned out.

content:
er 3, 2016
												NBA2K17... Where do I begin... To begin with, I have played NBA since 2010 and seeing the game evolve makes me happy, but there are still some major issues that the devs have to deal with, which I feel like should've been fixed by nowPros:+ Graphics and player faces looks amazing, this is the most realistic nba game ever made imo+ MyCareer being better than ever and all the other modes too! Really enjoy playing everything+ If you're a MyTeam fan, you will most likely get content each weekI wish I could add more pros for this game but there are too many issues I feel like to do so for now...Cons: - Glitches and animations while playing matches, for an instance, some bodyparts of some players would dissapear, and all the BS animations that you are familiar from earlier games still exist to some degree. - A program called Cheat Engine is used to modify the game, MyTeam for the most part. On console, the max you can list a player for is 100k, but using cheat engine, the price can be set to whatever creative amount you want, and to some degree this is game-braking... Especially if you're going to collect 2.5K cards for the best card in the game (debatable) this also makes VC useless in MyTeam since you're going to need a s*** loads of MT to afford just a 87-89 rated card... This has been a problem for 3 years so do not expect a patch...- VC is very overpriced (IMO) and VC ( the currency used in NBA2K games ) is pretty much needed for most activites within the game... The game is really fun but if you're going to buy it, you should get it for console if you have the chance. Would not recommend buying it on PC if you're going to play MyTeam, but every other mode should work fine...Giving this game a 7/10 simply because of the graphics and great modes , would've given higher if 2K would start work on theese PC problems that has existed for a long time

content:
r 30, 2016
												After playing a good 100 hours I can give my review,however I only play mycareer so its based on only this mode.It;s a good looking game again this year and quite fun,probably the best 2k I played at least.I like the new training instead of the old mode,having said that I do miss some old featsures like GM meetings and the options you had there.The gameplay is good ,the animations are good..until..yes until the cpu decides to start the 2k cheese.2k has always denied that they put in a program to basically screw you at times,sometimes more,sometimes less.The fact remains is that every single player experiencing this game will admit that the cpu often will flat out cheat you and it's no dofferent this year.After a 100 hours I am at a point where it then becomes frustrating and you get mad rage.If you love basketball this is still the best experience you will get in a video game,however if you already have a 2k version there isnt much need to get the newest,seeing they capped us this year and it quite honestly becomes more silly with every new version of 2k.This game is a mixed experience really and I would rate it a 6/10.

content:
er 3, 2016
												NBA2K17... Where do I begin... To begin with, I have played NBA since 2010 and seeing the game evolve makes me happy, but there are still some major issues that the devs have to deal with, which I feel like should've been fixed by nowPros:+ Graphics and player faces looks amazing, this is the most realistic nba game ever made imo+ MyCareer being better than ever and all the other modes too! Really enjoy playing everything+ If you're a MyTeam fan, you will most likely get content each weekI wish I could add more pros for this game but there are too many issues I feel like to do so for now...Cons: - Glitches and animations while playing matches, for an instance, some bodyparts of some players would dissapear, and all the BS animations that you are familiar from earlier games still exist to some degree. - A program called Cheat Engine is used to modify the game, MyTeam for the most part. On console, the max you can list a player for is 100k, but using cheat engine, the price can be set to whatever creative amount you want, and to some degree this is game-braking... Especially if you're going to collect 2.5K cards for the best card in the game (debatable) this also makes VC useless in MyTeam since you're going to need a s*** loads of MT to afford just a 87-89 rated card... This has been a problem for 3 years so do not expect a patch...- VC is very overpriced (IMO) and VC ( the currency used in NBA2K games ) is pretty much needed for most activites within the game... The game is really fun but if you're going to buy it, you should get it for console if you have the chance. Would not recommend buying it on PC if you're going to play MyTeam, but every other mode should work fine...Giving this game a 7/10 simply because of the graphics and great modes , would've given higher if 2K would start work on theese PC problems that has existed for a long time

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
ry 16
												Best basketball game out there, but they spent too much time developing things in the game that nobody uses at all, like the trading cards, instead of focusing on what people really want, which is a seamsless online multiplayer experience, which this game does NOT have....you can take you custom player and play in myPark like the 1 on 1 or 2vs 3 vs 3 street games, on the PC version only, because there are never any other players for matchmaking for regular online NBA team games, where players traditionally take their team and vs. other players teams online....like for example, you play as the warriors, and somebody else online pays as the pistons or whatever....also the team you are on in your career is not possible to be played with online at all, only your individual player in mypark...straight bull in my opinion, and the deal breaker?...THIS GAME HAS NO VOICE CHAT FOR PC!....So even if the online community was bigger than 20 peoples in the world playing at a time, and you coullld actually find somebody in matchmaking to play against?...you wouldnt even be able to communicate with them....same applies for your pick-up games in my park, literally no way at all to communiate with the players. if you are planning to purchase this game for anything other than the career mode, which is lacking and quite reptative imo aslo...DON'T DO IT...I made that mistake, and I shouldve just stuck with 2016, and I honestly would have if I would;ve known that a game company would release a game in 2017 that is an online multiplayer SPORTS game to top it of....that has....no...communication options...no voice chat....no text chat...nothing at all...and there are literally never more than about 10 people online during the afternoon prime-time, and if you want play with somebody in my park (dont know why you would, its nno fun without communication) other than between the hours of 5pm-10pm?...yah, good luck cuz it isnt going to happen. HORRIBLE WASTE OF MONEY AND I WOULD TAKE A REFUND INSTANTLY IF THAT WERE AN OPTION, BECAUSE I DIDNT KNOW ANY OF THESE THINGS UNTIL A WEEK AFTER I BOUGHT IT, and tried to go online for my first time, because I wanted to buld my character up first...I went to mypark at about 2am....and there was literally nobody there for a half hour straight until i gave up, and went online to the forums to see why that was, and come to find out, the online community is so small, that there is hardly ever anybody to play with...literally not 1 single person outside of the prime-hours, and ever if it were flooded with players? nope, still absolute horse crap because when theirs no communication between you and other players at all, what the hell is the fun in that? More fun to play vs. the AI...Literally...So yah, just take my word for it, and unless this game is $10 or less, don't buy it because you will be greatly dissapointed with 80% of the game....the only 20% you will like, is the myCareer mode, which once again, is lacking in an interesting story greatly, and is extreeeemely repetative....so IMO this game is good for a week of entertainment before you get completely bored with it. and for that? No more than $10.

content:
r 12, 2016
												-RPG basketball gameYou play as one character for one position.Can choose an "archetype" that pairs with your position. RPG nerds rejoice!Earn virtual currency from games to pay for more stats.-Lots of contentThere's lot of other modes: be manager of a team, simulate your own league, play online as one player or team. In multiplayer team mode, you collect cards that give your team better players and boosts.One player mode has lots of cutscenes well acted and entertaining and I feel a deep connection to the characters, deeper than some RPGs I played.So many animations and well blended, so many commentary variations, good music selection, can even make your own content.Well worth $60 - can buy cheaper from elsewhere-very steep learning curveTo this day I can't get defense down even as "lockdown defender", feels like you're on rollerskates on the floor or a car (i'm 93 overall). Impossible to chase your man well, acceleration needs to be toned down. Need to memorize dribble moves, although controls are somewhat intuitive. -UI a little confusing sometimesYou won't see important tooltips if you use a mouse, gotta use a controller. Took me a while to find out how to create a new character. Also lack of a manual can make it hard for newbies, like not knowing how to get badges or what certain attributes do (really depended on youtube).-xbox one controller a little weirdCan't use right stick aim properly, degrees always off center. Don't have this problem with other controllers.-Other suggestions for developersDon't like the virtual currency concept, makes the game like a pay to win (or pay to save time). Would be nice to skip movies or a watch later option. Also make transition scenes faster to make it easier for grinders. Also my game settings keep resetting even though I saved them. But other than that a great iteration.Looking for an alternative? Try Freestyle2: Street Basketball (seems fine except for the passing and blocking dunks)

content:
y 12
												This game has really taken a turn for the worse since 2k15. Its unrealistic. I could handle it when it was making small improvements in the motion and animations department, because the game stayed true to realism. This game has scrapped that and decided realism isnt important anymore. The animations look great, the defense and the way players move feels awesome, but in terms of how realistic the game is in comparison to the actual NBA, this game is awful. For example, I can play MyTeam with an all star team lineup and still to a team like the Atlanta hawks just because every single person on their team can all of a sudden shoot threes at a 100% from minimum 2 shots. And thats not an exaggeration. Every single player (excluding Dwight) that got time in that game from the Atlanta hawks took ATLEAST 2 3 point shots and made atleast 2. (Some made more, some took more). Mean while, I have Steph Curry WIDE open in the corner atleast 4 times and doesnt hit a single one. One of the shots I can understand was a little contested but the other 3 were not. This is just one example. There are many more that have frustrated me over the time that this game has been out and to be quite honest, im ready to uninstall this game. It sucks because I am a major fan of 2K and what they have done with the basketball gaming industry. But theyre getting to above themselves and not listening to fans want like they used to...remind you of any other companies?WOULD NOT RECCOMEND THIS GAME! Go back to 2k15 or even 13.

The MyPark is highly bias being that shooters (such as my self) have to deal with crappy lag (even though im using ethernet wired connection) while the dunks and layups are press a button and be done with. The sharpshooter has some of the stupidest attribute caps on my career and if you wanna go show out on my park dont try to shoot jumpshots. (my shot meter doesnt even show, one tap and its full making me brick). Bigmen are too fast in this game while guards (unlesh slashers) basically have average speed. If you ask me this game has really good content but the gameplay is trash on my park. The design is too bias and unrealistic being that both curry and irving have really great handles (as all point guards should have) but im stuck on a attribute cap of 79 :( why even bother guarding a center if you cant jump to steal the ball. Oh and ball handling in this game is a joke. one poke and its out. I'm dissapointed in this game. I had so much hopes for it and it only delivered on graphics and new content but the gameplay is aweful being that they over rated defense.

content:
ry 19
Product received for free
												After being very disappointed with the lackluster at best titles 2K has put out for the past few years, including 2K16 last year for the PS4, I had no intention of buying 2K17.  The only reason I decided to play it was because of the free to play weekend on Steam.  It was a good chance to try out the game for free plus see how it ran on my newly built gaming PC as I make the transaction from console back to PC.Keep in mind, I NEVER play online, due to cheaters and everyone choosing the Cavs or the Warriors every game.  I also won't review any mode that makes use of VC (myPlayer, myPark, etc).   I have never bought VC and don't plan to because I am very against micro transactions. Because of this, my review is only for offline quick play and offline franchise mode.  Also keep in mind this is my first NBA2K game on the PC so some things I mention may have already been here since I'm comparing it to 2K16 for PS4.After finishing downloading the game I ran a quick play just to get a feel of the game and for the most part the game ran very smooth on my PC.  Graphics are good but since I never played this on my PS4 I don't have anything to compare it to.  Player models are great and look like their real-life counterparts.  There is great detail when you zoom closer and for the arenas I played it, they look true to life.  AI seems somewhat improved from last year, so it doesn't feel like the game is blatantly cheating you (i.e non stop offense rebounds for the CPU, constant missed layups, blocked shots always going back to the CPU, etc).  But I originally said the same thing about 2K16 until I started getting more games in then the cheating became more rampant.  There are still some shake my head moments that I've encountered, like knocking the ball away for an easy fast break score and the player I was controlling would just stop for no reason allowing the CPU to get the ball back.  Also some CPU rebounds seemed highly unlikely but for the most part these are toned down from last year. (so far)I also like the ability to coach and run plays on the fly, it took some getting used to, but I finally started getting the hang of it at the end of my free to play period.  Another thing I really like about the presentation is how the game switches up the broadcasting crew.  Last year it was Kevin Harlan, Greg Anthony, and Clark Kellogg every single game, but this year they have random announcers each game, sometimes it would be the crew I mentioned above, other times it would be Doris Burke, Steve Smith, Chris Webber, and a couple of others.  Its a break from the monotonous broadcasting in previous years.  I suspect however if you play a lot of games, even the new broadcasting approach would get old.   The pregame, halftime and post game crew is still Kenny, Ernie, and Shaq and they have some new dialogue, but even during my free period they started repeating themselves.Franchise mode is pretty much the same from last year.  So everything from 2K16 is still here including some problems:1.)  Like 2K16, If you edit your team's jersey, you cannot easily go back to the default uniforms without downloading them back from the 2K community.2.)  NBA Championship celebration is still lackluster as always.  No locker room celebrations from what I saw; just a few seconds of celebrations from the players, and then it just skips to the trophy presentation, then cuts to the MVP holding the MVP trophy.   I will say the ring ceremony the following season is a little better than 2K16.  In addition to my complaint on this, also if your team had won its first championship the previous season, they get no championship patch on the back of their jerseys like they do in real life.  Also, if your time adds a title, then the trophy count does not increment.  This may be hard to implement, so it is nitpicking, but at the minimum it should at least add the patch.3.)  This year added the money ball rack to the All star weekend 3pt contest, but there is no way to place your money ball rack in the All star weekend 3 point competition like they can do in real life.  For every player its always the last rack. 4.)  Dunk contest is the same as last year with the exact same dunks.  5.)  All star game still shows Air Canada Centre on the center billboard, even though the court says New Orleans.  Also on All Star Saturday, the court is clearly still in Toronto.6.)   In 2K16, the Raptors jerseys had the all star patch on them even when entering later years in your franchise, I didn't get to confirm that this still occurs this year with the Pelicans, but I am sure its still there.Despite the issues, its a pretty good game offline speaking, but I feel I could get bored with it after a while.  As I said before, I'll never play online, and that is where it seems most of the issues lie.The only way I can begin to recommend this game is if you are strictly offline and only if you can get it for around $30.  $60 is just too much to pay if you are only going to use it for off line play.  I enjoyed my free play but even with the $39 sale price this weekend, I still won't get it. If it comes down to $30 down the road, I may consider itI'm on the fence with this one, aside from a few additions there is nothing really new here and many of the issues and oversights from last year carry over to this year.  If you do any online play, then I would say pass on this one.  If you are strictly offline play, then wait until it goes down to $30 or so because its not worth the full price tag.For reference my PC specs are as follows and I had no performance issues with game play.Intel i5 6600Geforce GTX 1070ASUS Z170E16 GB DDR4 SDRAM2 TB 3.5 HD480 GB SSDWindows 10

r 9, 2016
												This game has great potential but it doesn't live up to it unfortunately.  The biggest problem I have is it runs much worse than nba 2k16, I have to drop most settings down a notch to get any type of consistent gameplay.  I have a gtx 1080 and even with 120 fps the gameplay isn't smooth, there are many instances of microstutter and the motion is so inconsistent.  The animations are jerky, the cloth physics seem off, even the ball suffers from jerky motion and an odd shadow effect at times.  There is nothing worse in my opinion than a sports game that suffers from microstutter or framedrops, the graphics certainly don't seem to be good enough for me to drop settings on a gtx 1080. Maybe in two months when they patch this game it will be worth $60, not at this time though.

content:
ber 28, 2016
												I'm the type of person who buys NBA 2k every year. I like the franchise mode, quick play, and messing around with the historical teams. I almost always purchase the game on xbox/ps4 and when I haven't I've kind of regret it. Normally even though I've had a PC way above 2k's recommended specs the game always seemed to be worst on pc. Controller support was never what I wanted, game seemed to run poorly, and I just felt the experience was better on console.I purchased NBA 2k16 last year on PS4 and hated it. The mechanics of the game felt broken, it seemed to run worse than I expected, and the commentary left something to be desired. Specifically a layup was practically impossible, post up shots with trash players were automatic, and any garbage player could block you from a mile away. I had to customize game sliders alot before I got to a playable experiance.I felt so burned by NBA 2k16 that I almost didnt get NBA 2k17. Since I recently upgraded my graphics card (1060) I caved and decided to give NBA 2k17 a shot on PC and I'm glad I did. The game runs very smoothe and looks great on max setting, my controller works perfectly, the physics of the game feel much better, they added a shot meter on layups (I'm a huge fan of this change), and it seems like they made an effort to throw out alot of last years game play.I do wish they'd add better commentary to the throw back teams (they had great commentary in 2k10 or whatever the 1st jordan title was) and I've yet to test online play but I would definately recomend this game to any NBA fan. I'd also say that if your on the fence about PC or Console go PC this time.

content:
ber 22, 2016
												Poor keyboard support and frustrating navigation of menus.No way of skipping cutscenes. Most of them are long and have no player influence.Less responsive gameplay than 2k13 or 2k15.Extended Review after 200+ hours of gameplay and numerous patches:This game is still badly broken and by far the least fun I've had playing a 2K game. Gameplay issues that have plagued all previous titles - Bad help defence, constant terrible double teams, your character being stuck in cement and running in quicksand, teammates going out of their way to brick wall you, broken pass selection, teammates still allowing way too many rebounds etc. etc. are all features of this title once again.They also made fouls and turnovers even more frequent. As usual, fouls in the paint are a given, but add to that virtually every steal attempt and more regular fouls on jumpshots. Meanwhile the AI can strip you at will without even a steal animation.Onto the bugs that have destroyed the game thanks in part to the stupid archetypes that severely limit the kind of character you can create.My first character was a shot creator PG pre-patches. I played the full 82 game season and abandoned the character, the first character I've even given up on because the shot timing and badges were/still are bugged made every shot an F other than open dunks.My second was a Glass Cleaner C and after some patches were finally released, it was fun for a little while, minus all the frustrations listed above from previous versions. But after unlocking almost all of the badges and winning a championship, I was ready to go back to a guard role.Thinking that maybe the game would be fixed by now, I created a Slasher SG and was going okay until unlocking the badge Relentless Finisher, which started bugged, was fixed, and is bugged again. Every layup is an F and will miss.Welcome back to Free Throw Simulator 2k17..3 characters, 2 abandoned. 2K have already released multiple patches and hotfixes and I doubt they will continue much longer. The game is unfortunately broken trash.

												So, I'm going to be pretty negative with this one. First off, the gameplay and graphics feel and look like this is a 2008 video game... It's on PC, is supposed to be "nextGen" visuals, and it isn't. NBA 2k13 looks better than this game does... and thats nearly 5 full games ago! The scan a face tool, well it's annoying at best to use. Not very optimally created. The game as a whole, unless you have a PC powerful enough to run 4k, looks like complete crap. The MyPLAYER mode was an improvement in my mind. Giving a legitimate depth and story to YOUR career, FIFA 17 did this with a static pre-made character and it was phenomenal, so thumbs up there 2K! Other issues include shotty internet connections and speeds (and I DO have good internet, seeing I can host 6 people all on an MMO on my internet at the same time with no major issues). So I'd rate this game a 2/10. Definitely cut corners compared to console and is most certainly NOT worth 60 dollars.

content:
ber 21, 2016
												A little about me. I have 332 hours in NBA2K16. ALL those hours are Franchise mode playing EVERY game @ 9 minutes quarters including playoffs (On Superstar Diff.). I have NEVER played any other game mode honestly. So now you know how I play the game I wanna talk about this year compared to last from a Franchise mode players perspective except all I want to talk about is controls. THEY ARE HORRIBLE!!!! I find myself flying around the court almost out of control on defense. On offense I found directional passing really off and throwing bad passes to people I wasnt even aiming for. The shot meter is different too and I was willing to give it a couple games to adjust before berating it but after 12 hours I was still shooting horribly and sometime I would slightly move the stick and my player would do a full move almost automatically (and get blocked). That mostly happend when I would try to pump fake (couldnt do it). I was getting super frustrated and even had to drop the difficulty to no avail. It was not fun and I LOVE the NBA 2K series. Im going back to 2K16 tho and continue my franchise :)If you already own and played a lot of 2K16 I do not recommend. If you're new you wont know any better so go for it.
